intro: Lippia juncea, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and opposite leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Lippia juncea is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
